hotels.name: Casa Campos
hotels.desc: Charming boutique hotel in Roma Norte with rooftop terrace
hotels.longDesc: This Roma Norte gem combines colonial charm with modern comfort, perfect for families wanting to explore Mexico City's most vibrant culinary and cultural neighborhood from a stylish home base.

hotels.name: La Posada Tulum
hotels.desc: Beachfront eco-friendly resort with jungle access
hotels.longDesc: An eco-conscious beachfront retreat that bridges jungle and sand, ideal for families seeking a balance of relaxation, adventure, and sustainability in Tulum's bohemian setting.

restaurants.name: Restaurante Rosetta
restaurants.desc: Celebrated modern Mexican-Italian in Roma Norte, gorgeous courtyard
restaurants.longDesc: This award-winning Roma Norte favorite showcases creative Mexican-Italian fusion in an enchanting courtyard, offering refined dining that family travelers will find both elegant and welcoming.

restaurants.name: M√°ximo
restaurants.desc: Chef Eduardo Garc√≠a, refined Mexican cuisine, Roma Norte favorite
restaurants.longDesc: Chef Eduardo Garc√≠a's masterful take on Mexican cuisine celebrates fresh ingredients and traditional techniques, making this intimate Roma Norte restaurant a must-visit for serious food-loving families.

restaurants.name: ULTRAMARINOS DEMAR
restaurants.longDesc: A sleek, contemporary seafood bar in the heart of Roma Norte that brings fresh coastal flavors to the capital, perfect for families who want quality seafood without stuffy formality.

restaurants.name: Ki'bok Coffee Tulum
restaurants.desc: Specialty coffee roaster, bohemian Tulum vibe
restaurants.longDesc: This specialty coffee roastery captures Tulum's laid-back, bohemian spirit while serving expertly crafted coffee, making it a morning ritual worth building your day around.

restaurants.name: Restaurante Bar El Capit√°n
restaurants.desc: Local Tulum seafood, casual beachside dining
restaurants.longDesc: Casual beachside dining with fresh-caught seafood and stunning ocean views, this local favorite offers authentic Tulum flavor without pretension‚Äîexactly what families need after beach time.

experiences.name: Templo Mayor
experiences.desc: Archaeological site of Aztec temple complex in historic center
experiences.longDesc: This remarkable Aztec temple complex, discovered beneath Mexico City, reveals layers of pre-Hispanic history and artistry that bring ancient civilizations vividly to life for curious visitors of all ages.

experiences.name: Frida Kahlo Museum
experiences.desc: Casa Azul, the iconic blue house and museum
experiences.longDesc: Casa Azul's vivid blue walls and intimate rooms showcase the artist's iconic paintings, personal artifacts, and bohemian spirit, creating an unforgettable window into Mexican culture and creativity.

experiences.name: Chich√©n Itz√°
experiences.desc: Iconic Maya ruins with El Castillo pyramid
experiences.longDesc: One of the New World's most impressive Maya archaeological sites, featuring the iconic stepped pyramid El Castillo, this destination combines stunning architecture with profound historical significance.

experiences.name: Cenote Swimming
experiences.desc: Swimming in crystal-clear underground cenote pools
experiences.longDesc: These natural limestone sinkholes with crystal-clear underground waters offer a uniquely refreshing and magical experience‚Äîpart swimming hole, part geological wonder‚Äîthat kids and adults equally adore.

kidFriendly.name: Chapultepec Park
kidFriendly.desc: Large urban park with museums, zoo, and playgrounds
kidFriendly.longDesc: This sprawling Mexico City oasis combines world-class museums, an interactive zoo, historic castles, and playgrounds, providing endless discovery and play for families in one magnificent urban park.

kidFriendly.name: Xel-H√° Water Park
kidFriendly.desc: All-inclusive eco-adventure park with snorkeling and wildlife
kidFriendly.longDesc: An all-inclusive eco-adventure park where families can snorkel among tropical fish, zip-line through cenotes, and encounter wildlife in a stunning riverside setting designed for fun and conservation.

kidFriendly.name: Playa del Carmen Beach
kidFriendly.longDesc: This spacious, family-friendly Caribbean beach offers calm waters perfect for young swimmers, plus plenty of resorts, restaurants, and water activities to keep all ages happily entertained.

markets.name: Mercado de la Merced
markets.desc: One of world's largest open-air markets with produce and crafts
markets.longDesc: One of the world's largest open-air markets sprawls across entire blocks, overflowing with vibrant produce, regional crafts, and local energy‚Äîa sensory feast and cultural immersion for the whole family.

markets.name: La Lagunilla Market
markets.desc: Historic weekend market with antiques and crafts
markets.longDesc: This historic weekend market in a charming neighborhood is packed with vintage finds, handcrafted goods, and local character, making it perfect for families seeking authentic souvenirs and cultural discovery.

markets.name: Tulum Artisan Market
markets.desc: Local crafts and souvenirs from Tulum vendors
markets.longDesc: A curated collection of locally made crafts and souvenirs from Tulum artisans offers families the chance to support local makers while finding beautiful, meaningful pieces to remember the trip.

days.title: Roma Norte Culinary Introduction
activities: Arrival at Mexico City, settle into Casa Campos
Lunch at M√°ximo - refined Mexican cuisine
Afternoon stroll through Roma Norte neighborhood
Dinner at Restaurante Rosetta - gorgeous courtyard

days.title: Markets and Seafood
activities: Morning at Mercado de la Merced - vibrant market experience
Lunch at ULTRAMARINOS DEMAR - contemporary seafood
Afternoon exploring Frida Kahlo Museum
Evening at La Lagunilla Market for local crafts

days.title: Historic Center and Departure
activities: Morning tour of Templo Mayor archaeological site
Final lunch at favorite restaurant
Afternoon shopping in historic center
Departure from Mexico City

days.title: Beach Arrival and Cenote
activities: Arrival in Tulum, check into La Posada Tulum
Afternoon cenote swimming experience
Sunset beach walk on Tulum's white sand
Dinner at Restaurante Bar El Capit√°n - casual beachside

days.title: Wellness and Culture
activities: Morning yoga session at La Embajada Universal wellness center
Specialty coffee at Ki'bok Coffee - bohemian vibes
Lunch with ocean views
Afternoon exploring Tulum Artisan Market
Evening meditation and relaxation

days.title: Maya Ruins and Departure
activities: Day trip to Chich√©n Itz√° or nearby ruins
Lunch with local specialties
Return to Tulum for final sunset
Farewell dinner at favorite restaurant
Departure preparation
